author: Special Correspondent
text:
They tied her inside her house at Balarengapuram

The almirah from which gold and cash were taken away by two robbers from the residence of R. Vasantha in Madurai on Wednesday.— Photo: G. Moorthy

Two unidentified men robbed an elderly woman of her 12.4 sovereigns of gold and Rs.10,000 at knifepoint in broad daylight after tying her inside her house at Balarengapuram under the Teppakulam police station limits on Tuesday

The police said R. Vasantha (67) was all alone in the house on A.A. Road when the two men, who had masked their faces with monkey caps, barged into the house at around 11 a.m.

After gagging the woman with clothes and tying her hands with adhesive tapes, the robbers made her lay on the bed. Later, they snatched 12.4 sovereigns of gold ornaments from her and also took away valuables from the almirah in the bedroom.

The police said the woman was unwell. Her husband K.K. Rama Brahmma (74) said that he had gone out leaving his wife alone in the house. “My sister-in-law was expected to come home to take care of her,” he said.

The victim’s sister had come to her house and rang the calling bell for a few minutes. Later, she started pushing the wooden door as her sister had not responded to the calling bell. Suddenly, a man opened the door, pushed the woman inside and both the men started walking on the street.

“Weavers in the street had noticed the duo walking away from the house and then taking to heels,” Mr. Brahmma said.

The Teppakulam police have registered a case of robbery and are on the lookout for them.
title: Two masked men rob woman at knifepoint
